definition: forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: But it was also a bold attack on feudalism and arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但它同時也是對封建制度和包辦婚姻的一記猛擊。

sentences.english: This is an example of the apparent success of arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 這是一例表面看來很成功的包辦婚姻。

sentences.english: Arranged marriages happen overnight with the couple not knowing each other.
sentences.chinese: 印度包辦婚姻現象嚴重，夫妻間甚至還未認識就結婚。

sentences.english: Even modern arranged marriages can have a large age difference within the couple。
sentences.chinese: 現代的包辦婚姻中也有很多年齡差距很大的夫婦。

sentences.english: This is where the crucial difference with arranged marriages in China lies.
sentences.chinese: 這就使其與中國的包辦婚姻的根本區別。

sentences.english: Now, 108 years later, the arranged marriage still rankles.
sentences.chinese: 年了，那段包辦婚姻仍然讓哈瓦感到不滿。

sentences.english: child brides sometimes set themselves on fire to escape arranged marriages.
sentences.chinese: 那些童養媳有時會通過自焚來逃避包辦婚姻。
